humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the tumor size as 2.2 cm, which falls within the range for T2 tumors (more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm). The T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, and the presence of ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) or the percentage of the tumor occupied by in situ component does not affect the T stage for invasive ductal carcinoma. Therefore, the pathologic T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for cancer is determined by the size of the tumor and whether it has invaded nearby tissue. In this pathology report, the tumor is described as having a diameter of 2.2 cm. According to the TNM staging system, a T2 designation is given to tumors that are larger than 2 cm in greatest dimension and less than or equal to 5 cm. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.
